paragraphs.zh-tw: This is a kindergartenwe designed in 2007. We made this kindergarten to be a circle. It's a kind of endless circulationon top of the roof.
paragraphs.en: 2007年我們設計了這一個幼兒園 我們將幼兒園設計成環帶狀 樓頂環狀循環，沒有盡頭

paragraphs.zh-tw: If you are a parent, you know that kids loveto keep making circles. This is how the rooftop looks.
paragraphs.en: 要是你有孩子 你就知道，小孩子喜歡兜圈 這就是樓頂外觀。

paragraphs.zh-tw: And why did we design this? The principal of this kindergarten said, "No, I don't want a handrail." I said, "It's impossible." But he insisted: "How about having a netsticking out from the edge of the roof? So that it can catchthe children falling off?" I said, "It's impossible." And of course,the government official said, "Of course you have to have a handrail." But we could keep that idea around the trees. There are three trees popping through.
paragraphs.en: 為什麼我們這樣設計？ 幼兒園園長說： 「我不想要欄杆」 我說：這不可能啊 但他堅持說：「要不在樓頂兩邊安裝一張網？」 「這樣就可以接住掉下來的孩子」 「笑聲」 我說：這不可能 當然政府官員說： 「欄杆是必須要有的。」 但我們可以將網用在樹邊 這裡突出來三棵樹

paragraphs.zh-tw: And we were allowed to call this rope as a handrail. But of course, rope has nothingto do with them.
paragraphs.en: 而且我們可以把把邊上的繩子叫欄杆 但當然绳子本身與欄杆無關

paragraphs.zh-tw: They fall into the net. And you get more, and more, more.
paragraphs.en: 小孩掉進網裡 然後又有更多的小孩去 還有更多 更多 「笑聲」

paragraphs.zh-tw: Sometimes 40 children are around a tree. The boy on the branch, he loves the treeso he is eating the tree.
paragraphs.en: 有時樹邊會有40個小孩 樹幹上的那個男孩 他很喜歡那棵樹所以他在吃那棵樹 「笑聲」

paragraphs.zh-tw: And at the time of an event, they sit on the edge. It looks so nice from underneath.
paragraphs.en: 要是有活動 孩子們會坐在樓頂邊上 從下往上看真不錯

paragraphs.zh-tw: Monkeys in the zoo. Feeding time.
paragraphs.en: 動物園的猴子 「笑聲」 餵食時間 「笑聲」「掌聲」

paragraphs.zh-tw: And we made the roof as low as possible, because we wanted to seechildren on top of the roof, not only underneath the roof. And if the roof is too high,you see only the ceiling.
paragraphs.en: 我們盡量把樓頂設計得低一點 因為我們希望看到樓頂的孩子 孩子不會祗留在樓底 樓頂太高的話，就祗能看到天花板

paragraphs.zh-tw: And the leg washing place --there are many kinds of water taps. You see with the flexible tubes, you want to spray waterto your friends, and the shower, and the one in front is quite normal.
paragraphs.en: 這是洗腳的地方這裡有很多水龍頭 大家看見那些活動水管 要是你想要往朋友身上灑水 還有沐浴噴頭 相片中的水龍頭很普通

paragraphs.zh-tw: But if you look at this, the boy is not washing his boots, he's putting water into his boots. This kindergarten is completelyopen, most of the year.
paragraphs.en: 但要是大家仔細看 這小男孩不是在洗靴子 他在將水灌進靴子裡 「笑聲」 一年裡，這個幼兒園大部分時間都是完全開放的

paragraphs.zh-tw: And there is no boundarybetween inside and outside. So it means basicallythis architecture is a roof.
paragraphs.en: 戶內和戶外沒有限界 簡單來說，這個建築物就祗是一個屋頂

paragraphs.zh-tw: And also there is no boundarybetween classrooms. So there is no acoustic barrier at all.
paragraphs.en: 課室和課室之間也沒有限界 所以這裡也沒有聲音的限界

paragraphs.zh-tw: When you put many children in a quiet box, some of them get really nervous. But in this kindergarten, there is no reason they get nervous.
paragraphs.en: 把那麼多孩子放在一個安靜的箱子裡 有些孩子會覺得很緊張 但是在這所幼兒園裡 孩子們不會覺得緊張

paragraphs.zh-tw: Because there is no boundary. And the principal says if the boy in the cornerdoesn't want to stay in the room, we let him go.
paragraphs.en: 因為這裡沒有限界 幼兒園園長說： 要是邊上的男孩不想呆在室內 我們就讓他出去

paragraphs.zh-tw: He will come back eventually,because it's a circle, it comes back. But the point is,in that kind of occasion, usually children try to hide somewhere.
paragraphs.en: 他會回來的這裡就一個圓圈，總會繞回來 「笑聲」 重點是：在類似的情況下 孩子一般會試著躲起來

paragraphs.zh-tw: But here, just they leave and come back. It's a natural process.
paragraphs.en: 但在這裡他們跑開了又會回來 非常自然的過程

paragraphs.zh-tw: And secondly, we considernoise very important. You know that childrensleep better in noise.
paragraphs.en: 第二，我們認為噪音很重要 大家知道，小孩在噪音中睡得更香

paragraphs.zh-tw: They don't sleep in a quiet space. And in this kindergarten, these children showamazing concentration in class.
paragraphs.en: 他們在安靜的環境下睡不著 在這個幼兒園 這些小孩在課堂裡表現出驚人的集中力

paragraphs.zh-tw: And you know, our kind grew upin the jungle with noise. They need noise.
paragraphs.en: 大家知道，我們的祖先是在森林噪音中成長的 孩子們需要噪音

paragraphs.zh-tw: And you know, you can talkto your friends in a noisy bar. You are not supposed to be in silence.
paragraphs.en: 大家可以在嘈雜的酒吧裡與朋友聊天 大家不應該停留在無聲狀態

paragraphs.zh-tw: And you know, these days we are trying to makeeverything under control. You know, it's completely open.
paragraphs.en: 大家也知道，現在 大家都在不斷嘗試控制所有事物 這裡是完全開放的

paragraphs.zh-tw: And you should know that we can go skiing in -20 degrees in winter. In summer you go swimming.
paragraphs.en: 大家也應該知道 冬天零下20度我們出去滑冰 夏天就去游泳

paragraphs.zh-tw: The sand is 50 degrees. And also, you should knowthat you are waterproof.
paragraphs.en: 沙子溫度有50度 大家也應該知道：我們是防水的

paragraphs.zh-tw: You never melt in rain. So, children are supposed to be outside.
paragraphs.en: 你不會在雨中溶掉 所以孩子們是應該留在戶外的

paragraphs.zh-tw: So that is how we should treat them. This is how they divide classrooms.
paragraphs.en: 我們就應該這樣對待孩子 這就是孩子們隔分課室的方式

paragraphs.zh-tw: They are supposed to help teachers. They don't.
paragraphs.en: 他們本應該幫助老師的 他們…不幫 「笑聲」

paragraphs.zh-tw: I didn't put him in. A classroom.
paragraphs.en: 不是我把他放進去的 課室

paragraphs.zh-tw: And a washbasin. They talk to each other around the well.
paragraphs.en: 還有洗手盆 他們在洗手盆邊聊天

paragraphs.zh-tw: And there are always some trees in the classroom. A monkey trying to fishanother monkey from above.
paragraphs.en: 課室裡總會有些樹 一隻猴子試著把另一隻猴子釣上去 「笑聲」

paragraphs.zh-tw: Monkeys. And each classroom hasat least one skylight.
paragraphs.en: 猴子 「笑聲」 每個課室至少有一個天窗

paragraphs.zh-tw: And this is where Santa Clauscomes down at the time of Christmas. This is the annex building, right next to thatoval-shaped kindergarten.
paragraphs.en: 聖誕節裡聖誕老人就是從這裡下來的 這是附樓 就在橢圓形幼兒園旁邊

paragraphs.zh-tw: The building is onlyfive meters tall with seven floors. And of course,the ceiling height is very low.
paragraphs.en: 這座建築衹有5米高，共七層 當然天花高度很低

paragraphs.zh-tw: So you have to consider safety. So, we put our children,a daughter and a son.
paragraphs.en: 所以你必須考慮安全問題 我們放入我們的孩子一個男孩，一個女孩

paragraphs.zh-tw: They tried to go in. He hit his head.
paragraphs.en: 他們試著跑進去 他撞到頭了

paragraphs.zh-tw: He's okay. His skull is quite strong. He is resilient. It's my son.
paragraphs.en: 他沒事，頭顱很結實 他復原能力很強，我的兒子 「笑聲」

paragraphs.zh-tw: And he is trying to seeif it is safe to jump off. And then we put other children.
paragraphs.en: 他在看跳下去安不安全 然後我們放入其他小孩

paragraphs.zh-tw: The traffic jam is awfulin Tokyo, as you know. The driver in front,she needs to learn how to drive.
paragraphs.en: 大家知道，東京交通阻塞相當嚴重 「笑聲」 前方司機，她需要學習如何駕駛

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now these days, kids need a small dosage of danger. And in this kind of occasion, they learn to help each other.
paragraphs.en: 現今 小孩子需要嘗試一些輕微危險的滋味 在這種情況下 他們學會互相幫助

paragraphs.zh-tw: This is society. This is the kind ofopportunity we are losing these days. Now, this drawing is showingthe movement of a boy between 9:10 and 9:30.
paragraphs.en: 這就是小社會。而我們現今的社會正缺少這樣的（教育）機會 這幅圖顯示一個小男孩的活動範圍 時間段是9：10至9：30

paragraphs.zh-tw: And the circumferenceof this building is 183 meters. So it's not exactly small at all.
paragraphs.en: 這座建築圓周為183米 所以一點也不小

paragraphs.zh-tw: And this boy did 6,000 metersin the morning. But the surprise is yet to come.
paragraphs.en: 這個男孩在早上跑了6000米 更讓人驚奇的還在後面

paragraphs.zh-tw: The children in this kindergartendo 4,000 meters on average. And these children havethe highest athletic abilities among many kindergartens.
paragraphs.en: 這個幼兒園的孩子平均跑4000米 這些小孩跟其他許多幼兒園的小孩相比 有最高的運動能力

paragraphs.zh-tw: The principal says, "I don't train them.We leave them on top of the roof. Just like sheep." They keep running.
paragraphs.en: 幼兒園園長說： 「我不去訓練他們。我們把他們放在樓頂。」 「就像羊群一樣」 「笑聲」 他們一直跑 「笑聲」

paragraphs.zh-tw: My point is don't control them, don't protect them too much, and they need to tumble sometimes. They need to get some injury.
paragraphs.en: 我的觀點是：不要去控制他們 不要過分保護他們 他們有時需要跌倒 也需要受一點傷

paragraphs.zh-tw: And that makes them learn how to live in this world. I think architecture is capableof changing this world, and people's lives.
paragraphs.en: 那樣會讓他們學習 如果在這個世界生存 我認為建築是能夠改變這個世界的 建築能改變人們的生活

paragraphs.zh-tw: And this is one of the attemptsto change the lives of children. Thank you very much.
paragraphs.en: 這也是改變孩子們生活的一種嘗試 非常感謝 「掌聲」

title: Takaharu Tezuka The Best Kindergarten You Ve Ever Seen
